TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The applicant is a lawyer . The respondent Government are represented by Mr P. Laptev , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant published CARDINAL articles in the regional newspaper “ Day by PERSON . PERSON – NORP - Volgograd”(“День за днем. PERSON - Сталинград - GPE ” ) . Both articles inquired into the circumstances of granting a new flat to PERSON , a judge of ORG and chairperson of ORG .

The first article , under the headline “ Legitimised Judge ” ( “ Судья в законе ” ) , appeared in the issue of DATE . The second article , entitled “ Voluntary Retirement of a Judge ” ( “ GPE отставка судьи ” ) , was printed in the issue of DATE .

The publications alleged that Judge PERSON had taken advantage of her position in order to obtain a CARDINAL - room flat for her family of CARDINAL and that she had given her old flat to her adult daughter instead of surrendering it back to the council as required by law . The second article suggested that Judge PERSON had applied for her resignation fearing an inquiry into her deeds .

Judge PERSON sued the applicant for defamation . She submitted that the applicant ’s assertions about her having unlawfully obtained a better housing were of a libellous nature . She considered defamatory the following extract from the first article :

“ The PERSON on the Status of Judges in GPE is applied selectively in LOC and its application is related not only to the high status of judges , but also to their office ... thus it may be understood that the equality of all [ citizens ] before law and courts ends where we talk about judges themselves . Hence the rule is ‘ the law is like a rudder , it goes where you bend it’ . ”
Judge PERSON also regarded the following passages from the second article as defamatory :

“ ... on having received a new flat , [ Judge PERSON ] should have surrendered the one she had occupied in the past . However , the ‘ surrendering’ only happened through privatisation [ of the old flat ] and its subsequent sale . In this way Judge PERSON dramatically ‘ improved her living DATE now she has got a new flat of a bigger surface and money for the old one . ”

“ Judge PERSON was forced to retire because of other circumstances ... A visit of a high - ranking official from ORG of GPE who came to investigate the complaints of Judge PERSON . [ concerning the termination of his powers ] has helped PERSON , the chairperson of the judges’ qualification panel for LOC , to make a decision on her retirement . ”

On DATE ORG ( GPE судей PERSON области ) sent a letter to the President of ORG , of which the applicant was a member , requesting that the applicant ’s bar membership be annulled . The letter referred to the applicant as an unethical lawyer who had published articles of “ clearly libellous nature ” and who attempted to exercise “ illicit and immoral ” influence on Judge PERSON to have her action withdrawn . The letter contained the following passage :

“ Realising the well - founded character of the action lodged and attempting to avoid a public declaration on the unlawfulness of his acts by a court decision , [ the applicant ] resorts to impermissible means , which violate the generally recognised moral standards , seeking to have [ Judge PERSON ] withdraw her claim in the court . ”

On DATE the Presiding Committee of the Volgograd Bar passed a decision to annul the applicant ’s membership because of “ unethical performance of his duties ” . The decision referred to disciplinary sanctions that had been imposed on the applicant in the past .
On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision . The applicant did not appeal against the judgment .

On DATE the ORG of Volgograd granted the defamation action . The court found that the applicant had not produced any evidence in support of his assertions that Judge PERSON had unlawfully refused to surrender her old flat or that her retirement had been somehow connected with the inquiry by a high - ranking official . The court also held that the headline of the first article “ Legitimised Judge ” was also damaging to Judge PERSON ’s reputation :

“ The court considers that a mass reader knows from the press , television , literature and essays , as well as from one ’s personal experience , that the term ‘ legitimised ORG [ вор в законе ] refers to a person with a long criminal record who enjoys respect and authority in the criminal milieu . The headline ‘ ORG Judge’ stylistically clearly alludes to the term ‘ legitimised ORG and semantically it is implied here that the ‘ ORG is a criminal . On this ground the court holds that the headline of the article damages honour , dignity and professional reputation of Judge PERSON because the [ applicant ] failed to produce any evidence of a breach of any laws by the plaintiff . ”
The court held the applicant liable for MONEY ( “ RUR ” , approximately EUR CARDINAL ) .
The applicant lodged a statement of appeal in which he contested the reasons of the judgment of DATE . A copy of the statement has not been made available to the ORG .
On DATE ORG , sitting in a CARDINAL - judge formation , upheld the judgment of DATE .
LAW guarantees freedom of thought and expression , together with freedom of the mass media .

Article CARDINAL provides that an individual may apply to a court with a request for the rectification of “ statements ” ( “ сведения ” ) that are damaging to his or her honour , dignity or professional reputation if the person who disseminated such statements does not prove their truthfulness . The aggrieved person may also claim compensation for losses and non - pecuniary damage sustained as a result of the dissemination of such statements .
